main.node: Search Actor Run ID - AT People
Get Actor Run Details - Apify Apollo

name: Triggers > Apify > Web Scraping Webhook Callback

nodes.name: Receive Callback - Webhook Apify Apollo
nodes.notes: PHASE: Input Purpose: Receive Apify webhook callback for Apollo actor completion events. Inputs: HTTP POST /apollo/leads with header auth and Apify headers including x-apify-webhook-dispatch-id. Outputs: Raw headers/body for dispatch lookup. Dependencies: Header Auth Webhook Apify credential; Apify. Special Cases: Body may be empty; header must be present or flow will fail downstream.

nodes.name: Get Webhook Dispatch - HTTP Apify
nodes.notes: PHASE: Execution Purpose: Retrieve the Apify webhook dispatch to extract actorRunId and metadata for this callback. Inputs: Header x-apify-webhook-dispatch-id from Webhook; Apify Bearer credential. Outputs: JSON dispatch including data.eventData.actorRunId and metadata. Dependencies: Webhook - Apify Callback - Apollo; Apify HTTP API; Bearer Apify credential. Special Cases: 401/403 for auth errors; 429 for rate limits; no retry configured.

nodes.name: Get Actor Run Details - Apify Apollo
nodes.notes: PHASE: Execution Purpose: Fetch Apify actor run details to determine completion status and get the dataset id. Inputs: actorRunId from Get Webhook Dispatch. Outputs: JSON with data.status and data.defaultDatasetId. Dependencies: Apify HTTP API; Bearer Apify credential. Special Cases: Status may be SUCCEEDED/FAILED/TIMED-OUT; gate downstream actions accordingly.

nodes.name: List Dataset Items - Apify Apollo
nodes.notes: PHASE: Execution Purpose: List items from the Apify dataset produced by the actor run using pagination. Inputs: dataset id and offset from subflow inputs; limit=100. Outputs: Array of dataset items. Dependencies: Apify HTTP API; Bearer Apify credential. Special Cases: Empty result indicates no more pages; handle 429 rate limits.

nodes.name: If Run SUCCEEDED - IF
nodes.notes: PHASE: Execution Purpose: Branch based on Apify actor run status being SUCCEEDED. Inputs: data.status from Get Actor Run Details. Outputs: True path triggers pagination; false path goes to Stop with Error. Dependencies: Get Actor Run Details. Special Cases: Non-SUCCEEDED statuses are treated as failures.

nodes.name: Fail Run - Error Handler
nodes.notes: PHASE: Error Handling Purpose: Fail the workflow when the Apify actor run did not succeed. Inputs: False branch from If Run SUCCEEDED. Outputs: Error thrown with message 'Apollo Run Status Error'. Dependencies: If Run SUCCEEDED - IF. Special Cases: Stops all downstream processing.

messageValues.message:
=## 🔹 Prompt (English)

**Role**
You are a precise and detail-oriented writing assistant.

**Action**
Summarize the full content of one web page (title + text) into a single coherent summary of around **150 words**, keeping all essential information.

**Requirements**

* Length: \~150 words (±10%).
* Preserve **all important elements** (main ideas, arguments, data, examples, quotes, calls-to-action, conclusions).
* Write in **clear, fluent English**, using complete sentences and smooth transitions.
* Do not copy text verbatim — always rephrase.
* The summary should be **comprehensive but concise**: nothing important is omitted, nothing unnecessary is included.
* Maintain the **tone and intent** of the original page (informative, persuasive, analytical, etc.).
* Structure the text as a flowing **narrative paragraph** (not bullet points), unless the source uses lists that must be reflected.

**Input format**
You will receive:

* **Page Title**
* **Full Page Content (text)**

**Output format**
A single **\~300-word summary** that accurately reflects the full content of the page.

=## 🔹 Prompt – Website Analysis

**Role**
You are a strategic business analyst specialized in decoding websites to identify what type of company they belong to and how they operate.

**Action**
Analyze the full content of a website (title, text, navigation, products/services, calls to action, etc.) and produce a structured report.

**Requirements**
Follow this exact structure in your output:

1. **Who (Company Identity)**

   * Type of company or organization
   * Sector/industry
   * Mission, values, positioning
   * Tone of communication (formal, casual, expert, etc.)

2. **What (Products / Services)**

   * Main products or services offered
   * Unique value proposition (USP)
   * Positioning (premium, accessible, niche, etc.)

3. **Who for (Target Personas)**

   * Intended audience(s)
   * Needs, problems, or pain points addressed
   * Level of expertise expected (general public, professionals, executives, etc.)

4. **Where (Markets & Geography)**

   * Regions or countries targeted
   * Industries or segments served
   * Languages and scope (local, national, international)

5. **When (Temporal Context)**

   * Current initiatives, events, or product launches
   * Evidence of maturity (startup vs established company)
   * Time-sensitive promotions or updates (if any)

6. **How (Strategy & Approach)**

   * Communication style and persuasion methods
   * Proofs of credibility (testimonials, certifications, partners)
   * Conversion strategy (calls-to-action, funnels, user journey)

**General Instructions**

* Cover *all* important elements — do not omit anything relevant.
* Always rephrase; do not copy text verbatim.
* Keep the report clear, professional, and easy to scan.
